title: £6.3m Pontypridd lido set for summer opening
article: A Grade II-listed lido in Pontypridd which has not been used for more than 20 years, will reopen in the summer after a £6.3m makeover. The lido was built at Ynysangharad War Memorial Park in 1927 and shut in 1991. The original site had just one large pool, but the revamped attraction will have three pools, changing rooms and sun terraces. Money for the restoration has come from the Welsh government, Heritage Lottery Fund and Rhondda Cynon Taf council.
